legal_paragraph_1: In accordance with the provisions of Articles 6-III and 19 of Law no. 2004-575 of June 21, 2004 for Confidence in the Digital Economy, known as L.C.E.N., users and visitors, hereinafter the User, to the site www.nicolasbilic.com, hereinafter the Site, are hereby informed of the present legal notice.
legal_paragraph_2: Connection to and browsing of the Site by the User implies full and unreserved acceptance of the present legal notice.
legal_paragraph_2_1: This legal notice may be modified or supplemented at any time, so users of the website are encouraged to review it regularly.
legal_paragraph_2_2: This website is normally accessible to users at all times. However, an interruption for technical maintenance may be decided by the Site, which will endeavor to inform users in advance of the dates and times of the intervention.
legal_paragraph_2_3: This legal notice is written in French. Only the original French version is valid and takes precedence over any translated or interpreted versions.
legal_paragraph_3: The Site is edited and published by Nicolas Bilic hereinafter the Editor, whose address is 204 Montée de la Grande Vigne, telephone number 06 45 90 13 4, e-mail address
legal_paragraph_3_1: This site was created by Nicolas Bilic EI, web developer, contact:
legal_paragraph_4: The Site's host is VERCEL Inc, whose head office is located at Vercel Inc. 340 S Lemon Ave #4133. Walnut, CA 91789, whose telephone number is (559) 288-7060.
legal_paragraph_5: Any reproduction, representation, modification, publication, or total or partial adaptation of the elements of the website, including its logo, by any means or process, is strictly prohibited. Any unauthorized use of the website or any of its elements will be considered an infringement and prosecuted in accordance with the provisions of Articles L.335-2 and following of the Intellectual Property Code (Article L.122-4).
legal_paragraph_6: The Site ensures that the User's personal data is collected and processed with due respect for privacy, in accordance with the French Data Protection Act no. 78-17 of January 6, 1978.
legal_paragraph_7: The site only collects users' e-mail addresses when they choose to contact us via the link on the site.
legal_paragraph_8: The e-mail addresses collected are used solely to respond to users' contact requests.
legal_paragraph_9: The collection and processing of e-mail addresses is based on the user's consent, expressed when they choose to send us an e-mail.
legal_paragraph_10: E-mail addresses and associated messages are kept for the time necessary to process and respond to user requests. They may be retained at a later date if necessary for follow-up or management purposes.
legal_paragraph_11: E-mail addresses and messages are not shared with third parties, unless this is necessary to respond to a specific user request or if required by law.
legal_paragraph_12: Users have the right to access, rectify or request the deletion of their personal data. To exercise these rights, they may contact us at the following e-mail address
legal_paragraph_13: Users also have the right to lodge a complaint with the Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés (CNIL) if they feel that their rights have not been respected. For further information, please visit the CNIL website: www.cnil.fr.
legal_paragraph_14: We take all necessary measures to protect personal data against unauthorized access, alteration or destruction.
legal_paragraph_15: Any use, reproduction, distribution, marketing or modification of all or part of the Site without the Publisher's authorization is prohibited and may result in legal action and proceedings as provided for in particular by the French Intellectual Property Code and the French Civil Code.
legal_paragraph_mediation: In case of a dispute between the Client and the company, the latter will try to resolve it amicably (the Client will send a written complaint to the professional or, if necessary, to the Service Relations Clientele professional). In the absence of amicable agreement or in the absence of a response from the professional within a reasonable time frame of one (1) month, the Client consumer at the meaning of article L.133-4 of the code of consumption will be able to enter freely, if a disagreement exists, the competent mediator registered on the list of mediators established by the Commission for the evaluation and control of the mediation of the consumption in application of article L.615-1 of the code of consumption, that is to say:
legal_paragraph_mediation°3: Adresse : 24 rue Albert de Mun, 33000 Bordeaux
legal_paragraph_mediation°4: Consumers can contact a consumer mediator to resolve any disputes amicably.
pp_paragraph_1: This privacy policy may be modified or supplemented at any time, therefore, users of the website are encouraged to review it regularly.
pp_paragraph_2: The Client declares that they have read the entire privacy policy by visiting the website and accept it without restriction or reservation.
pp_paragraph_3: This privacy policy is written in French. Only the original French version is legally binding and takes precedence over any interpreted or translated version in another language.
pp_paragraph_4: The Site ensures that the collection and processing of personal data comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the French Data Protection Act of January 6, 1978.
pp_paragraph_5: We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your personal data against any loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, or modification. Our website uses the HTTPS (SSL) protocol to secure data exchanges. Although no transmission method over the Internet is completely secure, we strive to apply best practices to protect your information.
pp_paragraph_6: When browsing the Site, the following types of data may be collected:
pp_paragraph_7: The collected data is used for:
pp_paragraph_8: Information submitted through site forms or sent to our professional email address (name, surname, email, message) is used solely to process and respond to your requests.
pp_paragraph_9: Cookies are files stored on your computer’s hard drive during your internet browsing, particularly on the website. A cookie is not used to collect personal data without your knowledge, but to record information related to your browsing on the site, which can be directly read by The Site during your subsequent visits and queries on the site (such as, for example, the pages you have viewed or the date and time of the consultation of these pages). By default, cookies are not automatically installed (except for cookies necessary for the operation of the site and the services of The Site). In accordance with applicable regulations, The Site will require your consent before implementing any other type of cookies.
pp_paragraph_10: Once you leave our store’s website or are redirected to a third-party website or application, you are no longer governed by this Privacy Policy or our website’s Terms and Conditions. You may be directed away from our website by clicking on certain links. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other websites and encourage you to read their privacy policies carefully.
pp_paragraph_11: Our website collects audience measurement data through Google Analytics services. The confidentiality clauses of Google Analytics services are available on their website. These statistics help us understand the usage and performance of our site to improve its functionality and content presentation.
pp_paragraph_12: We use external companies to manage the technical operation of the Website and our services, hosting, Google Analytics. These companies act as data processors for the personal data for which we are responsible. By accepting this Policy, you agree that we may also allow these data processors to handle data for which you are responsible. Some of these data processors and third-party service providers are located outside the European Union, particularly in the United States. You consent to our use of subcontractors in third countries without security guarantees, provided there is a legal framework governing the transfer of your personal data, such as compliance with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield.
pp_paragraph_13: Under GDPR, users have the following rights:
pp_list_3: Access, rectification, and deletion of their data
pp_paragraph_14: You can request a file containing all personal data we hold about you, including the data you provided. You can also request the deletion of your personal data. This does not include data stored for administrative, legal, or security purposes.
pp_paragraph_15: To exercise these rights, contact us at:
pp_paragraph_16: Personal data is retained for the following durations:
pp_list_6: Contact data (emails sent via the contact form): retained for 1 year after the last interaction.
pp_paragraph_17: All users can view, edit, or delete their personal information at any time. The site administrators can also view and modify this information.
pp_paragraph_18: If you wish to access, correct, modify, or delete any personal information we hold about you, file a complaint, or request more information, contact us at

cu_h2: LICENSE FOR FREE ACCESS TO THE SITE
cu_paragraph_3: This site grants you a limited license to access and use the site for your personal use. Under no circumstances are you authorized to download or modify any part of the site without written permission. This license does not allow you to use the site or its content for sale or any other commercial use.
cu_paragraph_4: This site or any part of this site must not be reproduced, copied, sold, or exploited for commercial purposes without express written permission.
cu_paragraph_5: You must not use techniques to copy a trademark, logo, or any other information (including images, text) that we own without explicit written consent by email
cu_paragraph_6: You must not use meta tags or any other hidden text containing our name without express written consent. Any unauthorized use will terminate the license we grant you.
cu_paragraph_10: This site allows, on a non-exclusive and revocable basis, to create a hyperlink pointing to the homepage or another page, provided that this link does not create a misleading, false, pejorative, or harmful character. Under no circumstances will the creation of this hyperlink engage the Site's responsibility, for any reason, regarding the content of the site. Any use in your link of the logo, brand, or graphics and graphic creations requires express written permission by email
cu_paragraph_11: The reasons mentioned above are for example purposes and should not be interpreted as exhaustive.
